BindTo(BusUnit, Component)

Allows binding on component. Now, after provided component or its gameObject will be destroyed - event subscription will vanish as well.

NewScope<T>(String)

Defines strongly {T} defined scope to stream any data. This will create new scope to pass IMPORTANT - subscribing on this scope will replace created scope with existing in map, if there is one.

Declaration
public static BusScope<T> NewScope<T>(string scope)
Parameters
Type Name Description
System.String scope

The scope id to stream data
Returns

Consequently rise evens based on items provided in parameters.

Publish<T>()

Publish empty message from type. Activator will handle class creation for you. Important - anonymous type wont be published!

Declaration
public static void Publish<T>()
Type Parameters
Name Description
T

Publish<T>(T)

Publish item

Important - all anonymous types will be considered as {System.Object} type, because they cannot be subscribed. Blackout.Core.EventSystem.EventBus.EventBus.IsAnonymousType(Type)

Declaration
public static void Publish<T>(T item)
Parameters
Type Name Description
T item
Type Parameters
Name Description
T

Publish<T>(BusScope, T)

Same as Stream<T>(BusScope<T>, T) Will stream (invoke callbacks) {T} item to the provided scope. Any scope subscribers (listeners) will receive provided item.

Declaration
public static void Publish<T>(this BusScope scope, T item)
Parameters
Type Name Description
BusScope scope

Scope to stream
T item

Any item (most preferable to use with simple data)
Type Parameters
Name Description
T

Any type, including dynamic and anonymous

Subscribe(BusCondition, Action<Object>)

Dynamic conditional subscribe. Will observe on message of type {Object} only when provided condition is true. Can be used only with Where(dynamic condition)... Usage: EventBus .Where(x => any condition ) .Subscribe(MessageClass x=>DoSomething());

Declaration

Conditional subscribe. Will observe on message of type {T} only when provided condition is true. Must be paired with Where{T} Usage: EventBus .Where{MessageClass}(x => any condition ) .Subscribe(DoSomething);

UnsubscribeAll()

Removes all events from EventBus. Use this only when whole app events needs to be wiped.
